dark.description: TODO: needs an alias but currently one does not exist

light.description: TODO: needs an alias but currently one does not exist

clear.description: TODO: needs an alias but currently one does not exist

light.description: TODO: needs an alias but currently one does not exist

lightest.description: TODO: needs an alias but currently one does not exist

large-header.description: Accordion header should be used to give prominence to the accordions.

small-header.description: Accordion small header should be used to give prominence to the small accordions.

banner-body.description: Alert banner body should be used on the body copy of an alert banner component.

banner-header.description: Alert banner header should be used on the header of an alert banner component

inline-body.description: Alert inline body should be used on the body copy of an inline alert component.

badge-label.description: Badge label also makes use of our smallest size and this should only be used in our badges.

current.description: Breadcrumb current should be used to give within the current state of the breadcrumb component.

link.description: Breadcrumb link should be used to give within the link state of the breadcrumb component.

large-label.description: Button label large should only be used within the button component

small-label.description: Button label small should only be used within the button component

checked-label.description: Checkbox checked label should only be used within the checkbox component, checked state

unchecked-label.description: Checkbox unchecked label should only be used within the checkbox component, unchecked state

label.description: Chip label should only be used within the Chip component
Combo link label should only be used within the combo link component

day.description: Datepicker day style should only be used within the day section of the datepicker component

header.description: Datepicker header style should only be used within the header of the datepicker component

week.description: Datepicker week style should only be used within the week section of the datepicker component

base.description: Footer base style can be used for all footer base styling elements.

hover.description: Footer hover style can be used for all footer hover styling elements.

counter-label.description: Form counter label style can be used for all form counter elements.

helpblock-label.description: Helpblock body style can be used for all helpblock elements.

helpblock-link-label.description: Helpblock body style can be used for all helpblock elements.

label.description: Form label style can be used for all form label elements.

optional-label.description: Form optional label style can be used for all form optional label elements.

placeholder-text.description: Placeholder body style can be used for all field placeholder text elements.

text.description: List text should only be used in bulleted list components or styles

small-text.description: small list text should only be used in small bulleted list components or styles

selected.description: selected state should only be used in mainnav component

unselected.description: unselected state should only be used in mainnav component

selected.description: selected state should only be used in submenu item component

unselected.description: unselected state should only be used in submenu item component

selected.description: selected state should only be used in mobile menu item component

unselected.description: unselected state should only be used in mobile menu item component

desktop-body.description: Modal desktop body should only be used in desktop version of the Modal component

desktop-header.description: Modal desktop header should only be used in desktop version of the Modal component

desktop-header-alert.description: Modal desktop header alert should only be used in the alert desktop version of the Modal component

mobile-body.description: Modal mobile body should only be used in mobile version of the Modal component

mobile-header.description: Modal mobile header should only be used in mobile version of the Modal component

mobile-header-alert.description: Modal mobile header alert should only be used in the alert mobile version of the Modal component

desktop-header.description: Overpanel header should only be used in the Desktop version of the Overpanel component

mobile-header.description: Overpanel header should only be used in the Mobile version of the Overpanel component

pagination-link-label.description: Pagination label should only be used within the Pagination Link component

body.description: Popover body should only be used within the body of the Popover component

header.description: Popover header should only be used within the header of the Popover component

body.description: Progress Steps body should only be used within the body of the Progress Steps component

header.description: Progress Steps header should only be used within the header of the Progress Steps component

minimum-label.description: Progress Steps minimum label should only be used within the progress steps component with the minimum state

number.description: Progress Steps number should only be used within the number of the Progress Steps component

checked-label.description: Radio checked label should only be used within the Radio component checked state

unchecked-label.description: Radio unchecked label should only be used within the Radio component unchecked state

label.description: Range Slider label should only be used within the Rangeslider component

content.description: Switch content should only be used within the Switch component

label.description: Switch label should only be used within the label area of the switch component

large-label.description: Tab large label should only be used within the tab component

small-label.description: Tab small label should only be used within the tab component

action-label.description: Table action label should only be used in the table component indicating actions

body.description: Table body should only be used in the table component

header.description: Table header should only be used in the table component

label.description: Tag label should only be used in the Tag component

selected-text.description: input selected text should only be used in components that extend Field component within UI-C when the component has input

unselected-text.description: input unselected text should only be used in components that extend Field component within UI-C when the component has ninput

body.description: Tile body should only be used within the Tile component

header.description: Tile header should only be used within the Tile component

body.description: Tooltip body should only be used within the Tooltip component

hero-display.description: The hero display type style should only be used on pre-auth experience in hero/banner sections. This is great to highlight a value prop and consider only using it once on a page.

section-display.description: Section displays are the largest, most prominent text styles used to highlight the topic of a particular section. There can be any number of sections on a page but can only have one section-display in a given section.

section-header.description: Section headers are used to highlight specific segments within section. There can be any number of section headers within a section.

section-subheader.description: Section subheaders are used to communicate additional information that the header may not have been able to fit to provide more context to the user.

body.description: Body is used for all standard copy across our digital experience.

body-prominent.description: Body Prominent should be used in our more dense experiences where a clear hierarchy using sizing isn't always possible. Using alongside with our body style, label offers higher degree of scanability of content.

hero-display.description: The hero display type style should only be used on pre-auth experience in hero/banner sections. This is great to highlight a value prop and consider only using it once on a page.

legal-body.description: Legal body is our smallest type style and should only be reserved for legal copy

link-action.description: Link Actions style should be used in call to action CTAs. These are slightly different than standalone links as they perform some type of bigger action that moves a customer further along their journey. These links are generally paired with buttons and if they exist on their own, an iconography is used alongside as an indicator that this is an actionable element.

link-action-small.description: Link Action Small can be used for links that are paired with smaller buttons. This can also be used to style prominent header navigation items.

link-body.description: Link body should be used when links are inline with body copy or within very close proximity of body copy.

navigation-primary.description: Navigation primary should be used for L1s or headers grouping navigation items together.

navigation-secondary.description: Navigation secondary should be used to L2s or navigation items that are under a navigation primary grouping.

section-display.description: Section displays are the largest, most prominent text styles used to highlight the topic of a particular section. There can be any number of sections on a page but can only have one section-display in a given section.

section-header.description: Section headers are used to highlight specific segments within section. There can be any number of section headers within a section.

section-subheader.description: Section subheaders are used to communicate additional information that the header may not have been able to fit to provide more context to the user.
